comment: Smart Data Models - ExcDC2A adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.EnergyCIM/master/ExcDC2A/schema.json
description: Adapted from CIM data models. Modified IEEE DC2A direct current commutator exciters with speed input, one more leg block in feedback loop and without underexcitation limiters (UEL) inputs.  DC type 2 excitation system model with added speed multiplier, added lead-lag, and voltage-dependent limits.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: efd1
contents.comment: Exciter voltage at which exciter saturation is defined (Efd1).  Typical Value = 3.05. Default: 0.0

contents.name: efd2
contents.comment: Exciter voltage at which exciter saturation is defined (Efd2).  Typical Value = 2.29. Default: 0.0

contents.name: exclim
contents.comment: (exclim).  IEEE standard is ambiguous about lower limit on exciter output. true = a lower limit of zero is applied to integrator output false = a lower limit of zero is not applied to integrator output. Typical Value = true. Default: False

contents.name: ka
contents.comment: Voltage regulator gain (Ka).  Typical Value = 300. Default: 0.0

contents.name: ke
contents.comment: Exciter constant related to self-excited field (Ke).  If Ke is entered as zero, the model calculates an effective value of Ke such that the initial condition value of Vr is zero. The zero value of Ke is not changed.  If Ke is entered as non-zero, its value is used directly, without change.  Typical Value = 1. Default: 0.0

contents.name: kf
contents.comment: Excitation control system stabilizer gain (Kf).  Typical Value = 0.1. Default: 0.0

contents.name: ks
contents.comment: Coefficient to allow different usage of the model-speed coefficient (Ks).  Typical Value = 0. Default: 0.0

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: seefd1
contents.comment: Exciter saturation function value at the corresponding exciter voltage, Efd1 (Se[Eefd1]).  Typical Value = 0.279. Default: 0.0

contents.name: seefd2
contents.comment: Exciter saturation function value at the corresponding exciter voltage, Efd2 (Se[Efd2]).  Typical Value = 0.117. Default: 0.0

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: ta
contents.comment: Voltage regulator time constant (Ta).  Typical Value = 0.01. Default: 0

contents.name: tb
contents.comment: Voltage regulator time constant (Tb).  Typical Value = 0. Default: 0

contents.name: tc
contents.comment: Voltage regulator time constant (Tc).  Typical Value = 0. Default: 0

contents.name: te
contents.comment: Exciter time constant, integration rate associated with exciter control (Te).  Typical Value = 1.33. Default: 0

contents.name: tf
contents.comment: Excitation control system stabilizer time constant (Tf).  Typical Value = 0.675. Default: 0

contents.name: tf1
contents.comment: Excitation control system stabilizer time constant (Tf1).  Typical Value = 0. Default: 0

contents.name: vrmax
contents.comment: Maximum voltage regulator output (Vrmax).  Typical Value = 4.95. Default: 0.0

contents.name: vrmin
contents.comment: Minimum voltage regulator output (Vrmin).  Typical Value = -4.9. Default: 0.0

contents.name: vtlim
contents.comment: (Vtlim). true = limiter at the block [Ka/(1+sTa)] is dependent on Vt  false = limiter at the block is not dependent on Vt. Typical Value = true. Default: False

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
